sentence: 20 ||| Results ||| 2.2 ||| From these, 90 consecutive patients with unstable angina or acute MI who fulfilled the inclusion criteria were prospectively included in the randomized protocol, and 44 patients received atorvastatin 40 mg daily and 46 patients placebo.
label: po.Size

sentence: 24 ||| Results ||| 2.6 ||| C-reactive protein levels significantly decreased from baseline to discharge and 1 month later in the placebo ( P b .0001) as well as in the atorvastatin group ( P b .0001).
label: i.SS

sentence: 25 ||| Results ||| 2.7 ||| However, the quantitative and proportional reduction was significantly higher in the atorvastatin group than the placebo group (62% vs 11% at discharge [ P b .0001], 84% vs 30% at 1 month [ P b .0001]) (Table II)  (Figure 2).
content: quantitative and proportional reduction was significantly higher in the atorvastatin group than the placebo group
label: i.SS

sentence: 34 ||| Results ||| 2.16 ||| Baseline T-C levels were comparable in both groups (194.3 F 36.2 vs 194.3 F 33.6 mg/dL).
content: Baseline T-C levels were comparable in both groups
label: i.SS

sentence: 55 ||| Results ||| 2.37 ||| There were no changes in WBC and fibrinogen levels over time and no differences between the atorvastatin or placebo groups (Table III).
content: no changes in WBC and fibrinogen levels
label: i.SS

sentence: 52 ||| Results ||| 2.34 ||| These findings showed that the reduction of CRP levels was significantly higher in individuals with more reduction in LDL-C in placebo group, but atorvastatin obtained higher effect on CRP levels at 30 days, independently of LDL-C reduction.
content: reduction of CRP levels was significantly higher in individuals with more reduction in LDL-C in placebo group
label: o.Treatment
